text.name: sys_description
text.text: The Dreamcast is a home video game console developed by Sega to succeeds the Saturn. Launched in November 1998 in Japan, it is the first sixth generation console preceding PS2 and XBOX to offer an online play experience. Unfortunately it ended prematurely in 2004 remaining the last console of SEGA because with a bad marketing reputation. It’s equipped with a 32-bit processor that includes a 128-bit arithmetic coprocessor, 16 MB of RAM, and an NEC PowerVR2 GPU to display 7 million polygons second and 16 million color simultaneously. It’s near a NAOMI arcade system board.
